body.p:
Your letter of the 31st May came to hand on the first
day of Sebuot, I hasten to communicate the result of my enquiry in relation
to its contents. Mr Isaac Leezer a young gentleman who has resided a few
years among us, I can confidently recommend as a person of steady habits,
of moral worth, a strict observer of our religious rites, possessing a cultivated
mind, capable of instructing your children in Hebrew and with a little practice
will be enabled to discharge the duties of Hazan—our holy language is perfect
ly familiar to him, he renders Hebrew into English and english into Hebrew,
with great facility and possesses a grammatical knowledge of both, he pronoun_
ces agreeably to the Hebrew mode extremely well and knows the Hebrew in reading
the Hebrew and Hebrew, with attention and experience the pronunciation will soon be
perfect, he has a passable voice, but will require some instruction in the festival
tunes. Mr Peixotto has kindly offered to instruct him, that gentleman has conver
sed with him on the subject. Mr L. is extremely diffident of his powers to
give satisfaction as a reader but take him all in all is willing to make an expe
riment. I have no hesitation in saying, take him all in all that he will
be a valuable acquisition to any congregation, he combines the qualifications of an
instructor and an exposer of our laws and customs, possesses a decent classical
knowledge, composes with facility and correctness, has an extensive historical
knowledge and is a bell? letters scholar.__his pecuniary circumstances are
perfectly easy and his relative & patron? is able to make him in some degree in-
dependent of seeking office as a means of support, those observations proceed
from myself and are not intended to influence your decision in relation to his compen
sation__I shall be glad to know that he is placed in a situation that will render
him useful to his religious community, tho' young, he is sedate, and with in-
creasing years and his love of learning, and pious conviction of the truths of
the Religion he professes he will if blessed with length of days become a
shining light in Israel—

Should you be inclined to view these characteristicks favourably
I have no fears on the score of responsibility I this incur, any further
communications in relation to this business will I presume be addressed
to Mr L_The congregation in this place is designated Hebrew
Permit me to make you the medium of a communication to the Parnass of your

respectable congregation and request the favour of adding my family name to the record
which is kept of the early contributors to the Old Synagogue; my name Hebrew will
be found among the purchasers of the corner stones of that building, of the four purchasers
I alone survive. I wish the name to stand Hebrew I presume there will
be no objection in thus gratifying a native of your city and one far advanced in
years__ If I can be useful to the Committee please command my
best services
